H0.text: Reactants are the constant external supply that a galvanic fuel cell requires.

H1.text: Generators are the constant external supply required by a galvanic fuel cell.

H2.text: Electricity is the constant external supply required by a fuel cell, which is a galvanic cell.

H3.text: Complexes are the constant external supply required by a fuel cell, which is a galvanic cell.

A4.text: Fuel cells are different from most batteries in requiring a continuous source of fuel and oxygen (usually from air) to sustain the chemical reaction

A5.text: Fuel cells are an electrochemical cell that converts the chemical energy of a fuel (often hydrogen) and an oxidizing agent (often oxygen) into electricity through a pair of redox reactions
